CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1939, pg. 18, reads: "Gaines Funeral Home Reflects 'The World of Tomorrow' Most Modern Equipment Plus Scientific, Efficient Service Marks New Step Forward ... Pictures reading top left to right: ... PREPARATION ROOM - Equipped with hydraulic table. Hot and cold running water.  The finest grade of chemicals known to embalming science for the preparation of your loved ones, is used.  A lady attendant is always available...THE FUNERAL services may be held in home, in the church or in Gaines' well appointed chapel.  Complete arrangements for the services will be made by one of the staff, including the minister of the family's choice, the music and musicians and even the pallbearers, if desired. - Photos by Harris ... George W. Gaines, Director of Funerals ... 220 Auburn Street, E. E., Pittsburgh, Pa."
TitMainTitle: Embalming room with photograph of 1938 Pirates baseball team at Gaines Funeral Home
